headline: Sharing Cultures With Pop-Up Meals
abstract: A new wave of cooks are hosting meals that explore their personal memories and culinary traditions.
lead_paragraph: At pop-up restaurants, where chefs temporarily set up shop in a dining room, a barn or even a dorm room, dinner is an improvisation, more jazz than symphony. For a limited time and a limited audience, a cook can riff with premeditated spontaneity.
